time_trend_data.indicator_description: ED visits due to heat stress represent part of the public health burden of extreme heat.

Compare.graph_title: Trends in Heat Stress: Heat Stress Emergency Department Visits - Age-Adjusted Rate 2005 to 2018

info.info_how_calculated:
The number of NYC residents treated in a NYC emergency department (ED) during the months of May-September for the effects of heat and light due to weather conditions or undetermined cause. Residents with a diagnosis of excessive heat due to non-environmental conditions were excluded. Data are based on date of visit and include those with a diagnosis of heat-related illness, even if that was not the principal diagnosis. The data also include patients admitted to the hospital after being treated in an emergency department. 

  

Counts are summed by 5-year age groups and divided by the population in each age group, using NYC DOHMH intercensal estimates; quotients are multiplied by the proportion of the 2000 US population in each age group. Age-adjusted rate is the sum of the weighted age-specific rates; expressed as cases per 100,000 residents.

 

Notes: The coding system used to represent diagnoses changed in October 2015. Cases occuring before October 1, 2015 are represented by International Classification of Diseases (ICD), 9th Edition, Clinical Modification (ICD-9-CM) codes 992.0-992.9, E900.0 or E900.9. Cases admitted on or after October 1, 2015, are represented by the ICD, 10th Edition, Clinical Modification (ICD-10-CM) codes T67, X30, X32.  Cases with diagnoses represented by ICD-9-CM code E900.1 (if admitted before October 1, 2015) or ICD-10-CM code W92 (if admitted on or after October 1, 2015) were excluded. Because of the October 1, 2015 change in diagnostic codes from ICD-9-CM to ICD-10-CM, changes in numbers and rates over time should be interpreted with caution because they may be in part due to changes in the coding system.
info.info_source: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) Deidentified Hospital Discharge Data, United States Census
